name: Macro Oscillator
description:
This algorithm is an implementation of the open source Braids Eurorack module by Émilie Gillet. This implementation should behave and sound identical to the original, with the caveat that the original module runs at 96kHz – for a totally accurate recreation, you would need to run the disting NT at 96kHz. Any demos or tutorials found online should apply just as well to this version. The documentation assumes some familiarity with the [original Braids manual](https://pichenettes.github.io/mutable-instruments-documentation/modules/braids/manual/).

The original Braids has a separate mode in which FM CV controls the choice of synthesis model, but the disting NT does not require this since Mappings can control the model parameter directly.
use_cases: Complex FM and granular sound design
gui_description: The interface mimics the original Braids module with knobs for Model, Timbre, Colour, AD envelopes (Attack, Decay, FM, Timbre, Colour, VCA), tuning controls (Coarse, Fine), quantizer settings (Scale, Root), and additional tweaks like Resolution, Sample rate, Trigger source/delay, Flatten, Drift, Signature, Gain. Inputs for Trigger, Pitch, FM, Timbre, and Colour are selectable via bus numbers.

specifications.name: Sample Rate
specifications.value: 96kHz (for full accuracy; lower rates may affect sound)
specifications.description: The original Braids module operates at 96kHz. While this implementation works at other sample rates, running at 96kHz ensures identical behavior.

specifications.name: Polyphony
specifications.description: Supports multiple voices when triggered via MIDI or I2C.

parameters.name: AD FM
parameters.description: Sets the amount by which the envelope affects the FM.

parameters.name: AD Timbre
parameters.description: Sets the amount by which the envelope affects the timbre.

parameters.name: AD VCA
parameters.description: Sets whether the envelope is applied to the volume of the output.

parameters.name: Trigger source
parameters.description: Enables automatic triggering on pitch changes.

parameters.name: Flatten
parameters.description: Applies a detuning in the lower and higher frequencies, to recreate some of the tuning imperfections of VCOs.

parameters.name: Drift
parameters.description: Recreates the drifting of a disastrously designed VCO.

parameters.name: Signature
parameters.description: Applies grungy glitches/waveform imperfections to the output signal. The exact behavior of this option is unique to each module built.

parameters.name: MIDI channel
parameters.description: The MIDI channel to receive on.

parameters.name: I2C channel
parameters.description: The I2C channel to receive on.
